snippet: Questions about data and the authors’ industry ties have surrounded a study about hydrofracking in Pennsylvania that was done by a new research arm at the State University at Buffalo.
abstract: Shale Resources and Society Institute, a research arm of the State University of New York at Buffalo, issues a report asserting that state oversight has made natural gas drilling safer; finding prompts backlash from students, faculty and a government watchdog group, who question study's data and authors' ties to the oil and gas industry.
lead_paragraph: Questions about data and the authors’ industry ties have surrounded a study about hydrofracking in Pennsylvania that was done by a new research arm at the State University at Buffalo.
